nodes.documentation: @notice Modifier so that only me (the arbiter) will be able to input results and initiate withdrawal to the winning player's address.
nodes.name: onlyArbiter

@notice Emergency switch function
 @dev Simple emergency switch function that only the arbiter controls and stops key functions from working if activated.

 @return true or false depending on whether there are currently players signed up for the game.

@notice Fallback function.
 @dev Stops random ether from being sent by not having "payable" modifier.

deposit(uint256).details: A check is in place to prevent further deposits after the second player

params._playerID: The IDs of the two players of their fantasy football teams on the official site

getPlayer1Status().return: true or false depending on whether there are currently players signed up for the game.

payout().details: onlyArbiter and emergency switch modifiers are present

params.score_1: The final scores of the two players (Single gameweek/weekend game).
params.score_2: The final scores of the two players (Single gameweek/weekend game).

params.var1: Two random numbers in order to test that the SafeMath library works properly
params.var2: Two random numbers in order to test that the SafeMath library works properly

toggleContractActive().details: Simple emergency switch function that only the arbiter controls and stops key functions from working if activated.

deposit(uint256).notice: Receives the cryptocurrency of both players and logs their addresses and IDs

getPlayer1ID().notice: Used by the arbiter to read the playerIDs in order to check the results.

getPlayer1Status().notice: Getter functions for player1_set and player2_set. Used to alert users in the UI of contract changes.

payout().notice: Checks who wins and pays out the ether, and then resets the game so that others can play

resetPlayers().notice: Resets the game when finished so others can play.

setResults(int256,int256).notice: Sets the results and calls the payout function. An additional 1 point will be awarded if there is a draw (FantasyPL tiebreak rules apply).

testLibrary(uint256,uint256).notice: Testing the SafeMath library even though we don't need it for this first version of the dApp.
